tasks.task: Selecting and using growing media and active ingredients for small fruit crops in pot culture.
subtasks: Identify the appropriate growing media based on container size and cultural practices.
Choose a growing media with high water retention for summer use in small containers.
Select a bark-based growing media for outdoor production and larger containers.
Consider the benefits of peat, bark, and perlite combinations for drainage and weight.
Use ProMix products tailored for greenhouse and outdoor production.
Understand the role of Mycorrhizae in enhancing nutrient and water uptake.
Apply Bacillus subtilis biofungicide to suppress root rots and reduce fungicide use.
Combine Mycorrhizae and biofungicide for comprehensive root health benefits.

tasks.task: Managing active ingredients and cultural practices for small fruit crops.
subtasks: Apply Mycorrhizae to roots of small fruits except blueberries.
Monitor nutrient uptake and delay nutrient deficiency symptoms with Mycorrhizae.
Evaluate resistance to environmental stresses through Mycorrhizae colonization.
Assess improved plant establishment and sustained growth with Mycorrhizae.
Apply Bacillus subtilis biofungicide to reduce root rot pathogens.
Evaluate cost savings from reduced fungicide drenches.
Measure the impact on plant health and crop production by combining biofungicide and Mycorrhizae.
